msDesc.head: Georgios the monk, Chronicle, Books II-V.

msItem.note: Table of Contents, tit. Ἀρχὴ τοῦ χρονικοῦ βιβλίου γεωργίου μοναχοῦ: ~

msItem.author: Georgios the monk
msItem.title: Chronicon
msItem.note: tit. Ἀρχὴ τοῦ χρονικοῦ βιβλίου:~ γεωργίου μοναχοῦ :- inc. Ἀδὰμ τοίνυν κατὰ τὸν σοφώτατον καὶ θεῖον ὑποφήτην μωϋσὴν (cf. ed. S. Wahlgren, Symeonis magistri et logothetae chronicon, Berlin, 2006, pp. 25.12 onwards; E. de Muralt (ed). Georgii monachi, dicti Hamartoli, Chronicon ab orbe condito ad annum p. chr. 842 et a diversis scriptoribus usq. ad ann. 1143 continuatum. St. Petersburg, 1859, pp. 31 onwards) … des. διὰ μησοτέκνου ὁρνέου τρέφεσθαι. Cf. PG 110. 309B; ed. C. de Boor, Georgii monachi chronicon, vol. 1, Leipzig, 1904, p. 255. 12.)

tit. Ἀρχὴ τῆς ᾽Ρωμαίων βασιλείας: - α:- inc. Μετὰ δὲ ταῦτα βασιλεύσας Ἰούλιος Καῖσαρ (cf. ed. C. de Boor, Georgii monachi chronicon, vol. 1, Leipzig, 1904, p. 293.10 onwards; PG 110. 349) … des. ἐν τῷ παλατίῳ ἀνήγαγον. (cf. PG 110. 1185B; ed. S. Wahlgren, Symeonis magistri et logothetae chronicon, Berlin, 2006, p. 339; ed. I. Bekker, Theophanes Continuatus, Ioannes Cameniata, Symeon Magister, Georgius Monachus, Bonn, 1838, p. 749.11

Additional pasted leaf with various notes and patristic extracts (John Chrysostom, Basil of Caeserea) in the hand of J. Morezenos on spiritual issues, such as confession and absolution of sins. Tit. Καὶ ὅσα ἂν δήσητε ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς, ἔσται δεδεμένον ἐν τοῖς οὐρανοῖς, καὶ ὅσα ἐὰν λύσητε ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς, ἔσται λελυμένον ἐν τοῖς οὐρανοῖς. (Cf. Matthew 18: 18), inc. Ἔνστασις. ὅτι λέγουσι τὸν Θεὸν τὴν ἐξουσίαν … des. ταύτην συνεχῆ μελέτην. The leaf contains also some mathematical calculations and a few notes possibly in Italian.

supportDesc.extent: xvi + 425 leaves (fols 139, 200, 300 have been in 2 parts each; fol. 22 has been omitted). 207 147

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorative head-pieces in red ink indicating beginning of certain chapters and book divisions: fols. vi(r), 139b(r), 224r, 241r

physDesc.additions: Annotations by J. Morezenos, especially in the beginning of the volume.

binding.p:
Typical Holkham binding of light brown leather, with Coke family ostrich crest in gilt in the centre of the upper cover; Date: early nineteenth century. Rebound by John Jones of Liverpool (worked for Holkham 1816–1823). The spine lettered in gilt:
GEORGII MONACHI
CHRONICA
GR.–
SÆC. XV
; in pasted black leather: MS.
HOLKHAM
Gr. 61

history.provenance: fol. iiir: + ἐκ τῶν μάρκου μορζήνου τοῦ κρητὸς καὶ θύτου.

Old Catalogue Nrs: 1st paste down in its verso (in the centre, in pencil): MS. Holkham Gr. 61; fol. i(r), in pencil: Holk. Cat. No 104 2965 D2B11 D3b10; fol. iii(r) (right margin): handwritten note in brown ink by B. de Montfaucon: 1698· Codex
62. num.
Georgii
Monachi ab
Adamo ad
Romanum Diogenem
Imperatorem
annorum
circ. 140; (top margin right): ΜΓον= Morezenos 43, Giustiniani 62. Olim Holkham Hall, Libr. of the Earl of Leicester, 295

recordHist.source: Description by Dimitrios Skrekas (2019), with the support of the Leventis Foundation, the Oxford Centre for Byzantine Research, the Yerolemou Trust and the Michael Marks Charitable Trust.

ref.title: Pinakes | Πίνακες: Textes et manuscrits grecs
